articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Niger's military leaders warned against any armed intervention in the country as West African leaders are set to gather in Nigeria's capital on Sunday for an emergency summit to decide on further actions to pressure the army to restore constitutional order.
articles.title: West African leaders meet over Niger coup, junta warns against intervention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six people have died after a small plane crashed in Kananaskis Country, a mountainous region west of Calgary, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) said on Saturday.
articles.title: Six people dead after small plane crashes in Calgary

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Once feted as a financial wizard, Lebanese central bank governor Riad Salameh leaves the post he has held for 30 years on Monday, his legacy stained by the devastating collapse of Lebanon's banking sector and corruption charges at home and abroad.
articles.title: Lebanon's veteran central bank chief leaves post with legacy in shreds

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: A top Israeli lawmaker said on Sunday that any forging of relations with Saudi Arabia did not appear imminent, citing what he described as sticking points in negotiations currently being held between Riyadh and U.S. mediators.
articles.title: Israeli deputy says normalisation with Saudis does not appear imminent

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Northern China on Sunday braced for potential floods from the Doksuri storm that caused havoc in southern areas, with residents in Beijing warned not to go outside due to expected record rains.
articles.title: Northern China prepares for Doksuri floods, Beijing residents told to stay indoors

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ten people were killed in central Russia after strong winds toppled trees and heavy rains disrupted the electricity supply in hundreds of settlements, Russia's Ministry of Emergency Situations said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ten people killed in fierce storms in central Russia - government ministry

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Central African Republic is voting on a constitutional referendum on Sunday which, if it passes, could remove a presidential term limit and allow President Faustin-Archange Touadera to run for a third term in 2025.
articles.title: Central Africa vote in referendum could extend Touadera's rule

articles.author: Tommy Wilkes
articles.description: Banks working to develop global standards on accounting for carbon emissions in bond or stock sale underwriting have voted to exclude most of these emissions from their own carbon footprint, three people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Banks vote to limit accounting of emissions in bond and stock sales

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Russia's Defence Ministry said it had brought down three Ukrainian drones early on Sunday that had been trying to attack Moscow.
articles.title: Russia says it brought down three Ukrainian drones attempting to attack Moscow, nobody hurt

articles.author: Robyn Mak
articles.description: China faces a long slog to artificial intelligence supremacy. It wants to be a leader in the field by 2030 and this month unveiled new rules governing the technology that are less onerous than expected. But closed online ecosystems, Beijing’s controls on internet content and U.S. curbs on semiconductor exports to the world’s second largest economy will hamper progress.
articles.title: Chinese AI arrives by stealth, not with a bang
